title: 1  Rstudio
text:
Rstudio is one the most comprehensive free interactive development environments (IDE) for R.
The following reference covers he major steps to install and configure your R studio.
Major steps include:

install the latest version of R
install Rstudio
configure Rstudio defaults and appearance

Once you have Rstudio installed you can select Tools >> Global options and configure your preferences e.g. apperance.

title: 7  AI coding help
text: There is a lot of hype around tools like chatGPT which is a class of large language models (LLM's) for usingnatural language inputs to answer questions, including how to write code.

title: 7  AI coding help
text:
7.1 Install chatGPT Rstudio add in

7.1.1 Prerequisites

Make an OpenAI account.
Create an OpenAI API key to use with the package.
Set the API key up in Rstudio


# install.packages(c("gptstudio","waiter"))
library(gptstudio)

title: 7  AI coding help
text:
7.2 chatGPT Rstudio add in

Try to ask the openAI LLM how it would code up some of the examples you have seen so far. Try running the code, giving feedback about any errors to the chatbot and see if you can customize and/or improve the code you have seen so far.

title: R programming for Data Science - A Beginner’s Guide
text:
This the following course covers the major topics for beginners to get started with R programming for data analysis and visualization.



How to get up and running with R using the Rstudio
Understand R data types and functions
Use data frame manipulation to wrangle data
Visualize and plot with ggplot2 and plotly
Exploratory Data Analysis
Put it all together by creating a reproducible data analysis reports
Use AI tools to improve your code





R >= 4.2.1
RStudio >= 2022.12.0 Build 353

See section on Rsudio to get more details.
